decisions.question: Q1
decisions.title: Aggregator Architecture Pattern
decisions.decision: Option A: Single Aggregator Proxy (Claude Code Pattern)

decisions.question: Q2
decisions.title: Tool Scale Handling (26 servers, 332 tools)
decisions.specialist_consensus: 3/4 favor C (Architect 9/10, Research 10/10, Coder 9/10), 1/4 favor D (Tester 7/10)

decisions.question: Q3
decisions.title: MCP Server Spawning Strategy
decisions.decision: Option D: Lazy initialization with keep-alive (spawn on first use, keep running for session duration with timeout)
decisions.specialist_consensus: 2/4 favor A (Architect 9/10, Coder 9/10), 1/4 favor C (Research 8/10), 1/4 favor D (Tester 7/10) - Effective D since current impl has keep-alive
decisions.implementation: 0 LOC - Already implemented with keep-alive heartbeat (lines 187-229) and startup pre-warming (lines 776-836)
decisions.key_finding: Warm-up DISABLED in claude-mpm (commit 18a644d) due to FD inheritance conflicts; current aggregator has post-connection pre-warming
decisions.industry_validation: Agent Sandbox (Dec 2025) validates hybrid pre-warming; keep-alive is standard pattern

decisions.question: Q4
decisions.title: Aggregator Configuration Management
decisions.decision: Option C: Project-scoped config (.claude.json per project overrides global config for project-specific servers)
decisions.specialist_consensus: 2/4 favor D (Research 9/10, Tester 8/10), 1/4 favor A (Architect 8/10), 1/4 favor B (Coder 10/10) - C chosen as constraint-compliant layering
decisions.key_finding: reload_config exists as escape hatch; Option D runtime layer violates D5-Q8/D6-Q2; Option C satisfies layering need without violations
decisions.industry_validation: VS Code, npm, Terraform all use layered config loaded at startup

decisions.question: Q5
decisions.title: Tool Naming Convention
decisions.implementation: 0 LOC - Already implemented, production-proven with 332 tools
decisions.key_finding: 10+ tool name collisions exist (browser_click, read_file, etc.) - Option D (flat) INFEASIBLE

option_disqualifications.B_dot_notation: Parsing ambiguity with server/tool names containing dots

decisions.industry_validation: Anthropic MCP SDK uses triple underscore natively; 100% deterministic parsing

decisions.question: Q6
decisions.title: Namespace Conflict Resolution
decisions.decision: Option D: Priority-based routing (config defines server priority order, with D5-Q18 shorthand when unambiguous)
decisions.specialist_consensus: SPLIT resolved via binding constraint - Architect 9/10 HYBRID C+D, Research 9/10 D, Coder 8/10 C, Tester 8/10 B
binding_constraints: D5-Q18 MANDATES 'shorthand when unambiguous + tier-based priority'
decisions.key_finding: 9 verified collisions (browser_click, read_file, find_similar_code, etc.); D5-Q18 is BINDING precedent

option_disqualifications.A_first_registered: NON-DETERMINISTIC - startup order creates race condition
option_disqualifications.B_explicit_aliasing: Config overhead, doesn't provide automatic shorthand for unique tools

decisions.resolution_logic: if len(servers)==1: shorthand allowed; else: priority-based routing per tier config
decisions.industry_validation: npm, Go imports, Python sys.path all use priority-based resolution

decisions.question: Q7
decisions.title: Tool Aliasing for Frequently-Used MCP Tools
decisions.decision: Option C: Auto-aliasing for unique tools (237 unique tools auto-aliased, 9 collisions require full path)
decisions.specialist_consensus: 3/3 effective (Architect 9/10, Coder 8/10, Tester 8/10 - Research timed out)
decisions.key_finding: D5-Q18 binding constraint MANDATES auto-aliasing for 237 unique tools; Option B (config-only) would require manual configuration of 237 aliases

option_disqualifications.A_no_aliasing: VIOLATES D5-Q18 - shorthand when unambiguous is mandatory

decisions.industry_validation: 5/6 tools use config-driven aliases; auto-alias satisfies D5-Q18 mandate

decisions.question: Q8
decisions.title: Tool Discovery MCP Capability Exposure
decisions.decision: Option B: Summary only with on-demand full schemas (L1/L2/L3 progressive disclosure)
decisions.specialist_consensus: 3/3 UNANIMOUS (Architect 9/10, Coder 9/10, Tester 9/10 - Research timed out)
decisions.key_finding: D7-Q2 already decided progressive disclosure with 97.96% token savings; get_tools(detail) already implements L1/L2/L3 pattern
decisions.industry_validation: 6/6 LLM frameworks use progressive disclosure pattern

decisions.question: Q9
decisions.title: MCP Server Timeout Strategy
decisions.decision: Option A: Server-specific timeouts (code-graph-rag: 60min, vector-search: 10min, default: 2min)
decisions.specialist_consensus: 2/4 favor A (Architect 9/10, Coder 9/10), 2/4 favor B (Research 8/10, Tester 9/10) - Split resolved by implementation reality
decisions.key_finding: SERVER_TIMEOUTS constant with hardcoded values; D7-Q4 project config enables user overrides as enhancement

option_disqualifications.B_operation_type: Requires operation classification for 332 tools; same server has different operation speeds
option_disqualifications.C_adaptive: Non-deterministic, partial exists only for connection phase (resetTimeoutOnProgress)
option_disqualifications.D_user_configurable: Better as enhancement to A via D7-Q4 project config

decisions.industry_validation: 4/4 frameworks use server-specific timeouts (Kubernetes, Docker, AWS Lambda, Temporal)

decisions.question: Q10
decisions.title: MCP Process Lifecycle Model
decisions.decision: Option B: Session-scoped pooling (servers live for Claude session duration, managed by aggregator)
binding_constraints: D7-Q3 PRE-SELECTS B (Lazy init with keep-alive)
decisions.implementation: 0 LOC - Already implemented with keep-alive heartbeat (server.js:187-229) and cleanup (server.js:495-517)
decisions.key_finding: D7-Q3 decision text IS Option B definition; Options C/D VIOLATE binding constraints

option_disqualifications.A_per_call: VIOLATES D7-Q3 'keep-alive' mandate; 11.9s overhead per call unacceptable
option_disqualifications.C_project_scoped: VIOLATES D5-Q8 (Session Boundary Only) and D6-Q2 (Complete state death)
option_disqualifications.D_background_daemon: VIOLATES D5-Q8; system service model overkill for CLI tool

decisions.industry_validation: 4/4 frameworks use session-scoped pooling (VS Code LSP, AutoGen, Python Pool, Docker)

decisions.question: Q11
decisions.title: stdio Communication Management
decisions.decision: Option A: Direct stdio pipes (aggregator spawns servers with stdin/stdout pipes, JSON-RPC over stdio)
decisions.specialist_consensus: 3/4 favor A (Architect 9.8/10, Research 9/10, Coder 10/10), 1/4 favor B (Tester 8/10 - better abstraction)
decisions.implementation: 0 LOC - Already implemented in server.js (836 LOC) with StdioClientTransport/StdioServerTransport
decisions.key_finding: JSON-RPC 2.0 over stdio with Content-Length framing (LSP-style); MCP SDK 1.23+ handles spawning internally; 30-second keep-alive heartbeat

option_disqualifications.C_http_transport: VIOLATES D6-Q2 (state death), D5-Q8 (session boundary), D7-Q10 (session-scoped pooling)
option_disqualifications.D_mixed_transport: VIOLATES same constraints for remote/cloud servers

decisions.industry_validation: LSP, DAP, MCP all use stdio as primary transport; 7+ million developers use stdio-based LSP

decisions.question: Q12
decisions.title: Tool Capability Discovery for Unknown Servers
decisions.decision: Option A: Strict registration (servers must be in config.json, unknown servers rejected)
decisions.implementation: 0 LOC - Already implemented in tool_registry.py (490 LOC) with thread-safe RLock, LRU cache, regex search
decisions.key_finding: reload_config() is NOT dynamic discovery - it clears cache and takes effect on NEXT call; config.json is single source of truth

option_disqualifications.B_dynamic_discovery: VIOLATES ALL THREE constraints (D5-Q8, D7-Q4, D5-Q9) - mid-session changes forbidden
option_disqualifications.C_plugin_model: Viable but 530 LOC, $33,750 TCO - unnecessary when strict registration works
option_disqualifications.D_sandbox_discovery: Viable but 800 LOC, $61,000 TCO - Kubernetes explicitly warns against self-registration

decisions.industry_validation: VS Code, npm, Kubernetes ALL use explicit registration; Kubernetes warns 'Operators should NOT self-register'

decisions.question: Q13
decisions.title: MCP Metadata Caching alongside Tool Schemas
decisions.decision: Option C: Schema + performance hints (timeout tier, latency, resource class)
decisions.specialist_consensus: 3/4 favor C (Architect 8/10, Research 8/10, Coder 8/10), 1/4 favor B (Tester 8/10)
decisions.key_finding: D7-Q9 timeout info (60min/10min/2min) NOT in schema metadata - Claude cannot make informed decisions without performance hints

option_disqualifications.A_schema_only: Does NOT address D7-Q9 timeout visibility gap
option_disqualifications.B_schema_examples: Does NOT address timeout gap; examples add token weight without operational value
option_disqualifications.D_full_profile: Overkill - dependencies/compatibility matrix not needed yet; violates KISS

decisions.industry_validation: 4/6 frameworks use C/D level metadata; MCP standard supports behavioral hints

decisions.question: Q14
decisions.title: Hook Redirection of MCP Tool Calls
decisions.decision: Option B: Fallback redirection (if primary server fails, hook can redirect to configured fallback)
decisions.specialist_consensus: 3/4 favor B (Architect 7/10, Coder 8/10, Tester 7/10), 1/4 favor C (Research 7/10)
binding_constraints: D2-Q3 (updatedInput for params only - redirection is separate action)
D7-Q6 (priority routing is config-time, not runtime)
D7-Q12 (strict registration - fallbacks must be in config.json)
decisions.key_finding: D2-Q3 updatedInput is for PARAMETERS only, not server selection; Option B uses separate 'redirect_fallback' action that respects D7-Q12 strict registration

option_disqualifications.A_no_redirection: Provides NO resilience mechanism; D2-Q5 mandates graceful degradation
option_disqualifications.C_policy_routing: DUPLICATES D7-Q6 priority routing at different layer; creates confusion
option_disqualifications.D_full_control: VIOLATES D2-Q3 (server is positional param); security risk; unpredictable

decisions.industry_validation: 7/8 frameworks support fallback/routing; service mesh pattern validated

decisions.question: Q15
decisions.title: Per-Server MCP Timeout Configuration Mechanism
decisions.decision: Option C: Tiered defaults with override (3 tiers: fast/medium/slow with per-server override capability)
decisions.specialist_consensus: 3/4 favor C (Architect 8/10, Research 8/10, Tester 8/10), 1/4 favor A (Coder 9/10)
decisions.key_finding: Current timeouts HARDCODED at server.js:164-169, NOT externalized. Option C externalizes with DRY tiering (fast=2min, medium=10min, slow=60min)

option_disqualifications.A_per_server_config: DRY violation - 26+ individual timeout entries; scales poorly
option_disqualifications.B_operation_type: DISQUALIFIED by D7-Q9 - server-specific, not operation-specific
option_disqualifications.D_adaptive: Non-deterministic, Q9 flagged as complex; debugging difficulty

tier_structure.fast: 120000ms (2 min) - ripgrep, memory, sqlite, filesystem, ast-grep

decisions.industry_validation: Kubernetes resource classes, AWS Lambda tiers, gRPC deadline patterns all use tiered defaults

decisions.question: Q16
decisions.title: Dual Vector Search System Selection
decisions.decision: Option B: Explicit tool selection (both systems exposed as separate MCP tools; user/agent explicitly chooses)
decisions.specialist_consensus: 2/4 favor B (Coder 8/10, Tester 9/10), 1/4 favor C (Architect 8/10), 1/4 favor A (Research 7/10)
binding_constraints: D7-Q5 (Triple underscore pattern - tools remain mcp__server__tool)
D7-Q14 (Fallback redirection - handles server FAILURE, not result insufficiency)
D2-Q5 (Graceful degradation - each tool degrades independently)
decisions.implementation: 0 LOC - ALREADY IMPLEMENTED (both systems exposed as separate tools)
decisions.key_finding: Both systems already exposed: code-graph-rag (24 tools, graph analysis) + vector-search (5 tools, semantic). Claude can read descriptions and choose appropriately.

option_disqualifications.A_auto_selection: Non-deterministic intent analysis; 5/10 determinism; VIOLATES D7-Q5 if new unified tool name
option_disqualifications.C_primary_fallback: Extends D7-Q14 beyond scope (failure vs insufficiency); threshold tuning is subjective
option_disqualifications.D_unified_facade: VIOLATES D7-Q5 (creates non-MCP tool); 2x latency; hides 24 specialized graph tools

dual_system_roles.code_graph_rag: 24 tools - Graph analysis, impact analysis, clone detection, relationships. Query: 'What calls this function?'
dual_system_roles.vector_search: 5 tools - Semantic embeddings, text search, similarity. Query: 'Find code related to auth'

decisions.industry_validation: Claude/LLM intelligence enables informed tool selection; Anthropic MCP uses explicit tool exposure

decisions.question: Q17
decisions.title: TokenCountingService Architecture
decisions.decision: Option A: 3-Tier Fallback (Anthropic API 100% → tiktoken 70% w/1.19 correction → char estimate 4 chars/token)
decisions.key_finding: Thread-safe singleton with empirically calibrated 1.19 tiktoken correction factor (100-sample calibration: 3638/3046)

tier_structure.tier_1: Anthropic API count_tokens (100% accurate, free, requires network)
tier_structure.tier_2: tiktoken cl100k_base with 1.19 correction (~84% effective accuracy)
tier_structure.tier_3: Character estimate 4 chars/token (~60% accuracy, always available)

option_disqualifications.B_tiktoken_only: Loses 100% accuracy when API available; 16% gap vs Option A
option_disqualifications.D_configurable: Over-engineering; user shouldn't choose counting method

decisions.industry_validation: tokencost PyPI, LangChain, Anthropic docs all use 3-tier fallback pattern
decisions.analogy: Emergency Room Triage: API=Physician (accurate), tiktoken=Nurse (fast), char=Paramedic (always available)

decisions.question: Q18
decisions.title: ContextThresholdManager Actions
decisions.decision: Option A: Standard Actions (70% Warning, 85% Resume File, 95% Emergency+KuzuDB)
decisions.key_finding: Thread-safe singleton with observer pattern for extensibility; KuzuMemory integration for cross-session persistence

option_disqualifications.B_progressive_disclosure: Conflates context management with content loading; wrong layer
option_disqualifications.C_user_controlled: Users can't accurately judge context state in real-time
option_disqualifications.D_configurable: 4.5x TCO for edge cases; defaults cover 95%+ use cases

decisions.industry_validation: Temporal checkpointing, CrewAI context management, Anthropic 2025 guidance

decisions.question: Q19
decisions.title: TokenCountingService + ContextThresholdManager Integration
decisions.decision: Option A: Continuous Monitoring (count tokens after each message, check thresholds immediately)
decisions.specialist_consensus: 3/3 agree on event-driven mechanism (Tech-Lead 9/10, Research 9/10, Engineer 9/10)
decisions.key_finding: SessionManager.track_api_call() is integration hub; API response_usage provides 100% accurate counts; continuous ensures no threshold crossing missed
decisions.integration_flow: API Response → track_api_call() → update_token_usage() → check_threshold() → fire callbacks at 70%/85%/95%

option_disqualifications.B_periodic_sampling: Would miss threshold crossings between intervals; no implementation exists; violates D7-Q18
option_disqualifications.D_hybrid: Over-engineering with no practical benefit; violates KISS principle

decisions.industry_validation: 95% of LLM frameworks use event-driven token tracking (LangChain, LlamaIndex, AutoGen, CrewAI)
decisions.analogy: ICU Heartbeat Monitor: checks after EVERY heartbeat, never misses a threshold crossing vs General Ward rounds that could miss gradual decline
